customData.content: April 2022: 64-year-old male presented with blood-tinged sputum of unknown etiology, estimated volume ~5 ml.

HPI.summary: 64-year-old male presented with blood-tinged sputum of unknown etiology, estimated volume ~5 ml.

customData.content: May 2022: Patient encountered a recurring episode of hemoptysis with similar attributes and volume, prompting a chest CT scan at Xingyi People's Hospital (Xingyi, China). Imaging examination identified a lesion in the posterior segment of the right lower lobe, accompanied by slight bronchial dilation and distal infection, measuring ~2.8×3.2 cm.

imaging.body_part: Posterior segment of the right lower lobe
imaging.finding: Lesion in the posterior segment of the right lower lobe, accompanied by slight bronchial dilation and distal infection
imaging.impression: Lesion in the posterior segment of the right lower lobe, accompanied by slight bronchial dilation and distal infection

HPI.summary: Recurring episode of hemoptysis with similar attributes and volume

customData.content: Patient was administered antitussive (10 mg codeine, taken orally twice daily), hemostatic (10 units posterior pituitary hormone dissolved in 250 ml 10% glucose solution for intravenous infusion) and anti-infective therapies (1.5 g cefuroxime sodium in 100 ml 0.9% sodium chloride solution administered via intravenous infusion, once every 8 h), but the patient's clinical status did not demonstrate any notable improvement.
5 days pre-admission: Axial and coronal CT scans of the chest show a mass in the right lower lung.

imaging.finding: mass in the right lower lung

customData.content: 1 day post-admission: Axial and coronal CT scans of the chest show a right lower lung patch with cavitation. Lung cancer was suspected and infectious lesions complicated with abscess formation could not be ruled out.

imaging.finding: right lower lung patch with cavitation
imaging.impression: Lung cancer was suspected and infectious lesions complicated with abscess formation could not be ruled out.

customData.content: 6 days post-recurrence of hemoptysis: Patient transferred to the Affiliated Hospital of Guizhou Medical University for further evaluation. Patient has a smoking history of >40 years, consuming ~15 cigarettes daily, and had abstained from smoking for 1 week. Physical examination revealed diminished breath sounds on the right side. Blood cell evaluations showed elevated inflammatory markers, including white blood cells, absolute neutrophils and neutrophil percentage.

HPI.summary: Recurrence of hemoptysis 6 days prior to transfer

social_history.description: >40 years, ~15 cigarettes daily, abstained for 1 week

findings: Diminished breath sounds on the right side

customData.content: Post-admission: Coagulation parameters, pulmonary function tests, whole-body bone scintigraphy and cranial CT findings all exhibited normal results. Chest CT scan exhibited patchy opacities in the right lower lobe with the presence of a cavity, measuring ~5.7×4.5 cm. The lesion was suspected to be indicative of lung cancer.

imaging.finding: patchy opacities in the right lower lobe with the presence of a cavity, measuring ~5.7×4.5 cm
imaging.impression: suspected to be indicative of lung cancer

customData.content: 2 days post-admission: Patient developed a high fever, with a maximum temperature reaching 39.2°C.

Post-admission: Empirical antibiotic therapy with cefuroxime sodium was initiated (1.5 g cefuroxime sodium in 100 ml 0.9% sodium chloride solution administered via intravenous infusion, once every 8 h).

Day 3 post-admission: Antibiotic treatment was switched to piperacillin (4.5 g piperacillin sodium in 100 ml 0.9% sodium chloride solution administered via intravenous infusion, once every 8 h) due to persistent fever.
Day 3 post-admission: Bronchoscopy with biopsies from the middle right bronchus and the posterior segment of the right lower lobe were performed; findings were inconclusive for lung cancer.

procedures.name: Bronchoscopy
procedures.location: middle right bronchus and the posterior segment of the right lower lobe

data.content: Progression from blood-tinged sputum to recurring hemoptysis, leading to initial chest CT scan.
Administration of antitussive, hemostatic, and anti-infective therapies following the identification of a lesion in the right lower lobe.
Lack of improvement with initial therapies, followed by repeat imaging.
Progression of findings on chest CT, leading to suspicion of lung cancer and possible abscess.
Recurrence of hemoptysis and transfer to another hospital for further evaluation, revealing smoking history, diminished breath sounds, and elevated inflammatory markers.
Further investigations including labs and imaging, with continued suspicion of lung cancer.
Initiation of empirical antibiotic therapy with cefuroxime sodium.
Switch to piperacillin due to persistent fever.
